WorkItem.Description:
b5 version of Rawr3 on EJ, Mac OS X 10.6.3, Safari browser.
 
If you select the bear model and the options tab, there are two settings for content level.  In both cases, the settings for "T9 Raids (10)" and "T10 Raids (10)" are ineffective, by which I mean that selecting them from the drop down list does not change the value in the corresponding numeric field.  Hilarity ensues.
 
Steps to reproduce:
 
Select "Normal Dungeons" in the survival soft cap drop-down.  Observe the corresponding numeric value is 90K.  Now select "T9 Raids (10)" or "T10 Raids (10)" and observe that the value does not change.  Now select any other content level and observe that the value does change.
 
Same behaviour on the raw target damage drop-down.
WorkItem.Summary: [Bear] some content level option settings ineffective

Comments.Message: I actually found with the 2.3.13 download that it removed the T10 raid (10/25/heroic) options altogether for my bear?

@ambermissy: I don't remember Rawr 2 ever having T10 settings.  2.3.12 didn't, for example.  Having the same options in both V2 and V3 would be nice, but I think that would be unrelated to the thing I'm reporting, which affects the T9.10 options as well.
Problem still presetn in Rawr3 b6.
Problem still present in Rawr3 b7.
